    • Method Detail

      • newAIArrowAttack

        AIArrowAttack newAIArrowAttack(RangedAttackMob mob,
                               double moveSpeed,
                               int attackTimeModifier,
                               int maxRangedAttackTime,
                               int maxAttackDistance)
        Returns a new AIArrowAttack Instance
        Parameters:
        mob - mob being assigned to this ai
        moveSpeed - move speed towards the target
        attackTimeModifier - higher numbers means longer attack times
        maxRangedAttackTime - longest wait between attacks
        maxAttackDistance - farthest distance the mob will attack from
        Returns:
        a new AIArrowAttack Instance

      • newAIAttackOnCollide

        AIAttackOnCollide newAIAttackOnCollide(EntityMob creature,
                                       java.lang.Class<? extends LivingBase> targetClass,
                                       double moveSpeed,
                                       boolean persistant)
        Returns a new AIAttackOnCollide Instance
        Parameters:
        creature - creature this AI belongs to.
        targetClass - The class type of the target of this AI.
        moveSpeed - speed the entity will move at when engaged in this activity.
        persistant - Whether or not the mob will attempt to find the target again after it is out of sight or unable to reach the target because it cannot find any path to take.
        Returns:
        A new AIAttackOnCollide Instance

      • newAIAvoidEntity

        AIAvoidEntity newAIAvoidEntity(EntityMob mob,
                               Predicate predicate,
                               float radius,
                               double farSpeed,
                               double nearSpeed)
        Returns A new AIAvoidEntity Instance
        Parameters:
        mob - The mob this ai belongs to
        predicate - A very specific Predicate implementation.

        The Predicate implementation of Predicate#apply(java.lang.Object) will be passed type of Entity. Your method will need to assert true if the AI should avoid the given entity type. Or false if it does not need to avoid the entityType.
        radius - Radius of area to check around mob
        farSpeed - movement speed when far from avoided entity.
        nearSpeed - movement speed when near avoided entity
        Returns:
        A new AIAvoidEntity Instance

      • newAIBeg

        AIBeg newAIBeg(Wolf wolf,
               float minBegDistance)
        Returns A new AIBeg Instance
        Parameters:
        wolf - Wolf that owns this AI.
        minBegDistance - distance threshold for a wolf to start begging. If a player is farther away, it won't beg.
        Returns:
        A new AIBeg Instance

        maxDistance - distance from owner the entity will try to stay in.

      • newAIMoveTowardsTarget

                                           double speed,
                                           float maxDistance)
        Returns A new AIMoveTowardsRestriction Instance.
        Parameters:

        speed - the speed the animal will move at.
        maxDistance - the max distance away targets can be
        Returns:
        A new AIMoveTowardsRestriction Instance.

      • newAINearestAttackableTarget

        AINearestAttackableTarget newAINearestAttackableTarget(EntityMob entity,
                                                       java.lang.Class<? extends Entity> target,
                                                       int targetChanve,
                                                       boolean shouldCheckSight,
                                                       boolean nearbyOnly)
        Returns A new AINearestAttackableTarget Instance.
        Parameters:
        entity - The EntityMob
        target - the class type of entities this mob should target.
        targetChanve - Change to target. Must be a positive number. Chanve that AI is targeted will be random integer from this number. If the random Integer is equal to 0 then the target will fail, there for 1 will provide a 50% change of target, 10 will have a 90% chance of target, and 100 will have a 99% chance of target.
        shouldCheckSight - whether or not the entity must be visible
        nearbyOnly - if the entity should only target nearby entities.
        Returns:
        A new AINearestAttackableTarget Instance.
